comments.body: @ciwang @saad-ali Is this expected that we are trying to unmount a path and it does not exist? Are we failing silently?
@ciwang @saad-ali Should this preamble be a util function as we are writing it three times?

> Is this expected that we are trying to unmount a path and it does not exist? Are we failing silently?

It is possible. Assume globalMountPath unmount succeeds but the OpenFile check afterwards fails (because there is a stray process holding on to a device mount in another namespace, for example) then subsequent calls to unmount will find no globalMountPath (since it has already been unmounted and removed).

> Are we failing silently?

Yes. We should `glog.V(5)` a warning message indicating unmounting is being skipped because the globalMountPath does not exist.

> Should this preamble be a util function as we are writing it three times?

Always good to have repeated code in one place instead of many.
I'm seeing weird indentation here..  gofmt needed?
All the `udevadm` stuff was a workaround for a GCE PD issue. It shouldn't hurt, but since it is unnecessary, we should remove it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +58,62 @@	glog.V(5).Infof("AttachAndMountDisk(...) called for PD %q. Awake and ready to execute. (globalPDPath=%q)\r\n", b.volumeID, globalPDPath)

	xvdBefore, err := filepath.Glob(diskXVDPattern)
	if err != nil {
		glog.Errorf("Error filepath.Glob(\"%s\"): %v\r\n", diskXVDPattern, err)
